title: 103_hr5098
content: The "Fort Peck Tribes-Montana Compact Act of 1994" approves and ratifies the water rights agreement between the Fort Peck Indian Tribes and Montana. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for water rights confirmed in the Tribes by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, subject to Secretary approval within 180 days. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission or 60 days after compliance with environmental laws. Parties can enforce agreements under section 1361 of title 28, and the Department of the Interior must treat information confidentially. The Department of the Interior must treat certain information related to Water Agreements as privileged and proprietary to the Tribes. The Tribes are limited from authorizing the use of tribal water rights outside the Basin. Additionally, an economic development fund is established in the Treasury. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact prohibits the Tribes from entering Water Agreements allowing tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established in the Treasury, funded by 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project, not exceeding $50,000,000 annually. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is administered by the Western Area Power Administration, with a cap of $50,000,000. The interest accrued on deposits is deposited in a separate account for tribal economic development and land acquisition within the Reservation. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is for employment opportunities, land acquisition, and improvement of acquired lands within the Reservation. Payments are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable, and shall not affect federal services or programs for the Tribes. Per capita distribution of funds to tribal members is prohibited. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" prohibits per capita distribution of funds to tribal members. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for the fulfillment of actions required by the Act. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact refers to the water rights agreement ratified in 1985. The Reservation is defined as the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The Tribes are the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. Tribal water right is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "Tribes" refers to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The term "tribal water right" is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "Fund" pertains to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund established by section 3(f)(1).
